page.title: 18Events and Changes in Dedham
page.content: Constable's mill is no longer there. Clover's mill ceased trading last year and is being converted into 37 flats. There has been a lot of local argument about this,because of the new resident's cars and traffic problems, but if it was a mill there would be a lot of heavy lorries.Our old school was knocked down last year.It had been empty for over 10 years.The Duchy of Lancaster sold the school to the Samuel Barker Trust and now there are three almshouses for old people on the site. Soon there will be a speed limit in this village which will be good and a car park which is badly needed.
